comments.value:
Hello

There seems to be a problem with the sign-up. The business fields have now become compulsory for anyone trying to sign up, even for non Travel Advice to Business newsletters - see below. They are only supposed to be compulsory for Travel Advice to Business - can you investigate asp?

[cid:image001.png@01CBA0F8.90DA72C0]
Looking at this.

Hi Morag,

Looking at this now as a matter of urgency.

Jamie
Thanks!
i'm actually talking rubbish ("" -is- false), that case it could be the default values that confuse this.

Ah, please do, forgot we had those validation rules in a separate file
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/coder/PHP%20-%20Registration.template

We need to check only if reason=businessProfile (or if the first field is filled in I think)

We also need to make sure the rules tie up with the form.

It may be that Lars edited this form on dev and it just didn't get copied across.

Ill leave it alone now, but can you let us know once you have it fixed directly and I'll let Morag know, as it may need someapplogies ;-)

thanks

Jamie

So checkBusinessProfileFilled *is* returning false but we're still getting errors?

(btw. if that's not the case can you make it return false - skip business validation - just while you look at the deeper issue)

This is supposed to be better now.

Nb. the earlier https issue is still not resolved, so flow is still a bit broken.

Hi Morag, 

This is now resolved.

Jamie
Thank you – were you able to find out what had happened?

Yes, we added the UK as a default value for BusinessCountry which was fine, but there was also some code that said "if /any/ of the business values is filled in, then check all the other /required/ business fields". In turn because the BusinessCountry now always got set (due to a default value) it meant it the form was also always checking for the business fields even for non-business users.

I'm still not 100% sure where this error crept in, I remember explicitly testing both new and existing registration in both cases, I think when we deployed the version that came with all the other fields closed up when reason=business that we may have only tested the business case.

Really sorry it slipped though, I hope it didn't cause significant issues for you.

The good news it is won't have affected any of the real business signups which I imagine was been the biggest registration drive recently.

* directly un-related, although we noticed still an issue while fixing this bug, is that the Load Balancer isn't maintaining sessions across https connections, the net result of this is that a user may log in and get a session set on one server but then may be sent back to another server without the session cookie and so appear to be logged out. I'll send a separate email with a clearer explanation and raise it with ITS.

Jamie

comments.value:
You know those tickers you get along the bottom of the screen on things like BBC News 24, and Sky Sports News, and general news channels? The ones that just contain scrolling text headlines and nearly always say ‘BREAKING NEWS’ on them?  We have one of those on the London 2012 live site big screens around the UK, and we’ve just been given permission by the BBC to put whatever information we want on them when the live sites are broadcasting London 2012 specific material (which is about 20 minutes every hour).
 
The ticker works by pulling in an RSS feed, and we were going to try and use our latest few news headlines and straplines. But after a few discussions our Comms team in general have decided that they’d like us to set up something a bit more complicated and we were wondering if you guys would be able to build this for us.
 
What we’re looking for is (we imagine) a form with entry fields which we can populate which will generate RSS that the live sites can pull in to populate to ticker.  We were imagining that from our end it would be as simple as a form with, for example, 10 text-only entry boxes. The form would recognise when fields were and weren’t populated and play the populated fields one by one in order, on a loop.
 
So, an example of what we might populate the fields with:
 
Field 1: 20th August 2010 – London 2012 has announced that pole dancing will now be the only Olympic sport
Field 2:
Field 3:
Field 4:
Field 5: 20th August 2010 – Usain Bolt bored of winning everything
Field 6:
Field 7:
Field 8:
Field 9: For all the latest news updates on London 2012 visit www.london2012.com, www.facebook.com/london2012, www.twitter.com/london2012
Field 10:
 
In this example, whenever we updated the form (and clicked a ‘submit’ button, or something?) it would recognise that certain fields were empty, and the RSS the form generated would populate the ticker with the populated fields consecutively. So it would loop 1, 5, and 9, ignoring the rest. We’re thinking we’d update it a lot with all sorts of info to keep things very topical.
 
Does this sound like something you guys could do?
How’s the spec / costing coming for this Jamie?

Hi Finn,

Are you OK with this coming off the retainer, if so I'd expect we'd spend 2 days writing, getting this setup.

What you've written below is fine it terms of a spec for us to work from, so if your OK with us progressing on this with an pretty firm estimate of 2 days then more than happy to progress, we'll prototype something a bit first and we can tweak a bit as we go along and once it's in place within those two days 

Is there any particular RSS format they need (as I said we can tweak this once started, it won't change costs, but would be good to know if there is a preferred version).

Shall we get started?

Jamie

That’s grand Jamie, yep.

Amy who does our video has sent a request to the beeb about what type of RSS they require, have cc:d her here as i’m off until Weds now.

Amy, if you hear from the BBC about this before I get back could you let Jamie know if you get a sec please?
I'm about to start with this - any news from BBC by any chance?

Finn,

To speed up the process a bit, can you please confirm that the display people can work with this rss:
http://www.london2012.com/test/bigscreenrss.xml

To edit the contents, go to http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/folder/test and edit the bigscreen (not bigscreenrss) page in the page editor.
Hey Janos. Yep, the beeb are happy with this rss, cheers for that

Hi Janos

Just wanted to check where we're at with this? I've kind of lost track with volunteering launching and all that. It looks like it's ready for testing with the BBC now that we've confirmed they're happy to work with the RSS the form will create.

Am I getting ahead of myself or is that right? :-/

Finn,

I think it's ready to go - I've moved it to the data directory to to make it more permanent. It works the same: edit, save & publish the bigscreen page, and the url they'll have to use is this:

http://www.london2012.com/data/bigscreenrss.xml

Cool, thanks Janos

Amy is going to talk to the BBC about setting things up, but I have a few questions which you may or may not know the answer to in the meantime.


1) Say the ticker is running live and we update it, then hit publish. Would you have any idea how that would effect the feed running on the screen? E.g. might it jerk back to the beginning of the looped text? I don’t know if that’s something the BBC’s set up would dictate or not

2) Should we want to expand on what’s been built so far, how difficult would the following be for you guys?:


a) Add the ability to set a start and end date on fields so that they are added and removed from the feed after running for a certain period.

For example, between April 1st and 3rd:

Field one says “Hello” and has no date settings
Field two says “Everybody” and is set to start at the beginning of April 1st and finish at the end of April 2nd
Field three says “How are you” and has a start date of the start of April 2nd and no end date

April 1st feed reads “Hello Everybody”
April 2nd feed reads “Hello Everybody How are you”
April 3rd onwards feed reads “Hello How are you”


b) Add some titles to the fields so that we can assign them to different teams here (I presume that’s pretty easy)


3) I assume there’s no character count on the fields? Is there any limit we should try and stay within or theoretically can the text in each field be as long as we want?

1) Can't really tell that - probably it's a question rather for BBC, not for us :). I imagine what they do is they clear the screen, reload the rss and then continue - which means a flicker is unlikely.

2. 
a) I guess another day with all the testing / preview and stuff.
b) I'm not entirely sure what you mean here.

3. There isn't, I'd love to apply something if BBC has one. I wouldn't want read anything too much longer than 40-60 character from the national theatre scroller.

Cool, thanks Janos, I’ll feed this back.

With the one that wasn’t clear, I literally meant adding labels above each field on the form, so it would look like this:


New Media team Field
<field data entry box goes here>

Press team Field
<field date entry box goes here>

Sustainability Field
<field date entry box goes here>

etc

Ah! This should be relatively easy - provided we're not publishing anything to the rss feed.

Do let me know when we can start working on these changes.

Thanks Janos

Yeah, nothing to publish to the RSS feed for that one.

We’ll have to find out how we want to share the fields between different departments, then I’ll find out the specific headings for you.

For the start and end dates on fields, I’ll check with Liz that it’s ok to take another day from the retainer and let you know...
I believe that Finn has responded to this by email. If not, please leave a note on this ticket.
To clarify, Liz has just approved the additional expenditure by phone.
And now I'm trying to break it.
It's now ready for testing.
Thanks Janos, Amy will be responsible for communicating with BT about this and she’s away this week so progress may be a little slow...

Hi Janos, this thread is back from the dead :-)

BBC have finally told us they're ready for testing. Potentially thick question: do we just need to give this link to them for them to be able to take the feed?: http://www.london2012.com/data/bigscreenrss.xml

We're gonna enter some test data now and then send this to the Beeb I think. You ok with that?
Finn, sorry for the delay. That's exactly the link you need to send them.
Marking as solved
Might be worth keeping open briefly Dan? We’re gonna test this shortly so may need to come back to it if there are any issues.

Hi Janos.

Do 'bigscreen' (the form we edit) and 'bigscreenress' (the rss generated, I assume) both have to published for this to work when the beeb test it?

Finn,

bigscreen is supposed to automatically publish the generated rss.
Cool, thanks
Marking as solved. If any issues arise, we can open another ticket.

Hello

We have a small piece of work upcoming on the International Inspiration section of our website:

* New landing page to update www.london2012.com/internationalinspiration
This will be a new page but will be similar to http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/index.php The main new thing is that we want to have a deep banner similar to the Sport pages, plus a larger media pod like the Games Maker one which plays through photos/video. I have briefed McCann to design this, but am wondering if it's something you can implement as you did with the Games Maker pages.

* New map page to embed a 'Get Set' map similar to the one at http://www.london2012.com/get-involved/volunteer/games-maker-roles-and-venues/games-maker-venues.php I will send you the map when it is available - we would just need an International Inspiration template creating which could support it

* Possible template tweak to content pages in the International Inspiration section - we would like all pages in the International Inspiration section to support a full-width banner similar to the ones in the Sport section http://www.london2012.com/games/olympic-sports/aquatics-diving.php Is this possible?

Grateful for your thoughts on how long it will take to do the above. Many thanks!
Setting to high, assigned to Jamie.
jamie says 5-10 days

Morag, this looks like it would be unlikely to need less than 5 days or more than 10 days. We can give you a better estimate when we have more information or some designs (or wireframes) to look at. Do you have a deadline?
We’d be looking at second half of October – is that possible?
Yes, it's possible. When would you be able to get designs to us? And what is your ideal launch date?
I would hope to have something to you in a fortnight – so by 15 October. We would like to have it up and running by 1 Nov if that’s not a stretch....

We used to have different levels of permission for users in the CMS e.g. some people could only edit and not publish, and we could constrain people's CMS use to a certain folder or section.

This seems to have disappeared from the CMS, so that all editors pretty much have the same rights.

The old system was really useful for us - can you advise what happened to it?

Morag Reavley
New Media Manager
London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games
1 Churchill Place
Canary Wharf
London
Direct dial: 020 32012 160
Reception: 020 32012 000

Hi Morag,

No it's still there, or should be !

The models is a User has a Role and a Role can have a number of permissions.

Each user can have more than one role, in which case the permissions merge.

Do you have an example of someone how has more permissions that they should?
Marking as solved, but please re-open if you are still having issues with user permissions. If you want to redefine or create new user roles, just let us know.

comments.value: Specifically, when should we be using 301s (permanent) and when 302s (temporary).
Due date set as Jan 31.

1) Currently:

All redirects created via the short url interface are 301 (Permanent) redirects.
http://www.google.com/support/webmasters/bin/answer.py?hl=en&answer=93633

Google will not penalize you for doing this, but will index / display the URL being pointed to and not the short form URL

We also periodically use 302 temporary redirects when setting up splash pages, ie. replacing the homepage with a splash page. Google normally (they have changed behavior in the past) shows the original page in the SERPS ie. "London 2012 : Home" but displays the Spalsh page "London 2012 : Mascots" when the link is clicked. This is only true for on-domain links ie. both sites / pages are on www.london2012.com

2) Going forward (post SEO development work)

To the outside world (or browsers / bots / spiders) short urls will appear as part of the site and not as redirects. This means that /volunteering to all intents and purposes is the Volunteering hub page. No 301 or 302 Redirects to worry about. It's all done transparently at the webserver/publication level and will appear to the work that that is the sites structure.

We probably want to turn off the old style 301 redirects once we launch the new style SEOpath unless there is a requirement to have multiple paths to a given page (ie. volunteer, volunteering, gamesmaker) in which case we need to keep them as we can only have one official short SEOpath per page (as these will basically become the canonical path for that page).

btw. the above is an answer to a question / clarification, there is no development work to be done here.

subject: SEO: Review of redirects
description: Specifically, when should we be using 301s (permanent) and when 302s (temporary).

comments.value: Page 19: "Adding or removing the .php extension from a URL does not make a difference: the page still loads. Additionally, the URL without .php will load with or without a trailing slash ( / ). Although appearing to be a minor issue, the presence of absence of a trailing slash also denotes a new URL and thus a new page."
Ideally, index pages should all be referenced with a trailing slash.
Due date set as Jan 31.

This ticket / issue is a bit of mix of various issues.

- adding / removing .php
This is a side effect / coincidence of there being a short / redirect url setup with the same path as the url without the .php 
Most pages on the site *do not* work when the .php extension is removed. If a short url is setup in future with the same path as another page without the .php this will still appear to be happening ie. we have a short url called "/diving" and a page called diving.php if we remove the .php it will appear to work but *only* becasue we have a short url which matches the filename without a .php extension.

- Trailing slash ( / )
This will be dealt with as part of the larger SEO url work, all index pages will end in /

- Index pages vs Trailing slash ( / )
This will be dealt with as part of the larger SEO url work, all index pages will end in / rather than index.php

=== EMAIL TO JAG 8 Oct 2010 ===
Hi Jag,

I have a few more questions regarding the staging environment:

1. Staging load-balancer

http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com is currently live to the general internet.

* ActionPoint 1. Although this is beyond my remit, I would advise retricting access in some way - either at an apache level, or at the akamai level, or at an o/s or hardware firewall level.


2. Staging servers: stage03/04

2.1. Apache

Currently, stage03/04's Apaches do NOT use NameVirtualHost's.

I recommend that we SHOULD use NameVirtualHost's. If Apache is set up differently to web01/04 then it introduces a whole class of error that cannot be caught by testing in the staging environment.

* ActionPoint 2. Can stage03/04 have Apache set up to use NameVirtualHost's please? We currently only need one host set up: vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com.

2. Rsync

Currently, stage03 is NOT synced with stage04.

* ActionPoint 3. Can stage03 be periodically synced with stage04 (in the same way as web01 is synced with web02,3,4) please?



Can I kindly request that these issues be addressed as urgently as is possible?

I ask, because the absence of the staging environment is preventing us from launching any new functionality (of which there is now a sizable backlog). This does not impact Kitsite, per se, but is likely to cause some issues very soon for locog staff (for example, I believe there is an important splash page required for next Friday, which we cannot promote without the staging environment in place).

Thanks, in advance,

Kieran

Internal notes:

Load-balancer
=============

 http://vip_staging_locog_www.london2012.com
Currently live, but will presumably soon be restricted.

nslookup suggests that this corresponds to: e3955.g.akamaiedge.net, which - presumably - means that stage03/04 are now behind the akamai load-balancer/cache.

 
Servers: stage03/04
===================

 213.120.228.148
 213.120.228.149

Access
------
Have same ssh-access rules as web01.
 username: webcontent
 password: same as web01
 accessible from milo

Apache
------
Currently, stage03/04's apaches do NOT use NameVirtualHost's.
Have requested that they DO use NameVirtualHost's (as per email, attached).
 
Rsync
-----
Currently, stage03 is NOT synced with stage04.
Have requested that this be enabled (as per email, attached)


Base-hrefs
==========
These are now written dynamically - i.e. in php, by checking the value of $_SERVER["SERVER_NAME"]. This means that we DON'T have to amend the base-hrefs when copying between the servers.

NB This is currently only true for templates that use <content:base/>

Other ones (e.g. re. registration will need to be amended manually).

RUNNING TOTAL

Kieran: 1.5 days (Oct 4-8)

Another hour spent writing an email to Jag.

Another hour spent writing emails to Jag / talking to Danny

Sent this email to Morag:

Hi Morag,

Danny indicated that you should be kept in the loop regarding the staging server, and change-management processes.

Here's a resume of the conversation I had with Jag today (which I should perhaps have CC-ed to you). I'm attempting to colour-code it. Please let me know if the formatting goes awry. I hope this all makes sense.
Kieran

1. Jag:

Hi all
It would be best to continue the work on the Staging servers once Jamie is back from holiday.  I think a lot of what has been asked may have already been implemented...
We can then schedule a conf call with BT/LOCOG/Kitsite.
Regards,

2. Kieran:

I am up to speed with what has already been implemented. The requests that I have recently made are for further enhancements to the current environment.
We can - of course - wait until next week, however my concern is that the 3 or 4 substantial pieces of work that we are waiting to launch will now be further delayed. As I indicated before, this does not impact us, but will impact the editorial team adversely.
I believe, for example, that a new ticketing promo is due to go live tomorrow, and a new splash page on Friday, regarding ticket pricing. I presume these are immovable deadlines (Danny, perhaps you could confirm?).
Perhaps this might be a time to suggest (on the editorial team's behalf) dropping the requirement for all new work to go through the staging environment until such a time as we actually have an operational staging environment?
Kieran

3. Jag:

Keiran
It was discussed that the ticketing splash page can be done as usual – as was done for volunteering. So this should not be impacted.
Could you let me know what additional pieces of work are scheduled?
Thanks.

4. Kieran:
- Hide quoted text -

* Chartbeat tags (work complete, but on hold)
* Shop (work complete, but on hold)
* Search bug: http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/1613 (fix ready, but on hold)
* Change to ticket promo (changes launched in absence of staging)
* Splash page. If you're just talking about the switching off/on of the splash page, then that's great that there's a process in place. If I'm to understand it correctly, though, the new splash page itself should be okayed on the staging server before going live?

We are very keen to ensure that we meet your staging requirements, but we're also very keen to push this current backlog live, and are thus happy to be advised - on a case-by-case basis - if certain projects can be launched without going through staging.

Perhaps this ticket should be closed: http://postcms.zendesk.com/tickets/1537
